medical_history.chief_complaint: Respiratory failure and hypotension with a cavitary lesion in the lung.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began approximately 1 week prior to admission with upper respiratory symptoms, cough, and shortness of breath that worsened on the day of admission, leading to collapse and loss of consciousness as symptoms intensified.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Rheumatoid arthritis diagnosed 10 years ago, previously treated with NSAIDs, sulfasalazine, and methotrexate; developed complications with carpal tunnel syndrome and abnormal liver function tests during treatment. Diagnosed with Gravesâ€™ disease 11 years prior, treated with radioactive iodine. History of hypercholesterolemia and allergic rhinitis. Underwent hysterectomy and bilateral salpingo-oophorectomy 2 years prior.
medical_history.family_history: Both parents had hypertension; mother had rheumatoid arthritis and a myocardial infarction in her 40s.
medical_history.social_history: Divorced, worked in an office, had grown children, did not smoke or drink alcohol, no known drug allergies.
